arm_group.description: the length between incisor and mandible angle
the length between mouth corner-mandible angle

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the facial measurements for determining the proper
      sizes of oropharyngeal airway. Investigators hypothesized that the length between incisors
      and mandible angle is more appropriate to estimate the size of oropharyngeal airway compared
      with the length between mouth corner and mandible angle.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Facial Measurements, the Length of Mouth Corner-mandible Angle and Incisors-mandible Angle, for Determining the Proper Sizes of Oropharyngeal Airway

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adult patients undergoing surgery that requires general anesthesia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  anticipated difficult intubation

          -  patients without teeth or with loose teeth

          -  cervical spine disease

          -  upper airway disease

          -  body mass index over 35 kg/m2

          -  pregnancy

intervention.description: the use of oropharyngeal airway (Guedel-type color coded oropharyngeal airway, Hudson RCI, Teleflex Medical, Research Triangle Park, NC) which size is the length between incisor and mandible angle
intervention.intervention_name: the length between incisor and mandible angle

intervention.description: the use of oropharyngeal airway (Guedel-type color coded oropharyngeal airway, Hudson RCI, Teleflex Medical, Research Triangle Park, NC) of which size is the length between mouth corner and mandible angle
intervention.intervention_name: the length between mouth corner-mandible angle

oversight_info.authority: South Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)

primary_outcome.description: The oropharyngeal airway will be inserted into the patient's mouth. Investigators will check the laryngeal view using fiberoptic bronchoscope and the adequacy of ventilation after the investigator ventilates the patient using the mask. If both the laryngeal view and ventilation are appropriate, the size of oropharyngeal airway will be considered as the proper size for the patient.
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 minutes after the start of anesthetic induction

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
